Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles

Stop and give way to the cyclist

Question: Who may legally require you to give a blood sample?

Answers.Answer: A police officer, an ambulance officer, other crash party
A medical doctor, other crash party, a police officer
A police officer, a medical doctor or an approved person
An ambulance driver, an approved person or a medical doctor

What is the speed limit from the time you pass an Accident sign until you are past the crash site?

Answers.Answer: To move into the traffic flow

Question: Which parts of the car must be in good condition to prevent too much noise and gases entering the car?

Answers.Answer: Good mud guards and mud flaps
A good silencer and exhaust system

Question: What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Pull over and allow it to pass

Answers.Answer: Move to the left as quickly as possible
Speed up and signal as you move to the left
Signal for at least 3 seconds before moving left
Slow down and signal as you move to the left

Question: What must you do if glass falls on to the road from your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Sweep it up straight away if you can do so safely

Question: What must you do at an intersection controlled by a Stop sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Stop only if you can do so safely
Continue driving unless you can see an oncoming vehicle

Answers.Answer: You may stop your vehicle if there are no buses coming
You may stop your vehicle between 6pm and 8am except on Fridays and Saturdays
You may stop your vehicle if someone stays with it
You may not stop your vehicle at any time

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When are you allowed to pass another vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are coming up to a blind corner or blind bend
When a vehicle has stopped at a pedestrian crossing
When you can see at least 100 metres of clear road in front of you once you have finished passing
When you are less than 10 metres away from a railway level crossing

Question: Which one of the following vehicles can you drive on a car licence?

Answers.Answer: Yes – if you drive at less than 20km/h

Yes – if you think it will not come off the trailer

Question: You may park your vehicle on a loading zone when:

Answers.Answer: you are loading or unloading people or goods
there is no other vehicle on it
it is between the hours of 12am and 6am
it is between the hours of 6pm and 6am

Question: What should you do if the vehicle behind you wishes to pass?

Answers.Answer: Move to the centre so that they cannot pass
Speed up so that they will not need to pass
Move as far to the left side of the road as is safe
